page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND BORGUE
page.content:
{ }
This is a typical rural landscape where landscape is the predominate land cover. The scattered farms are generally units, with small fields divided by stone walls. The land rises gently from the rocky coast to about 100m. Although there is no commercial forest the area is quite well wooded round the farms and village, with naturally sown deciduous trees. The ample supply os stone is used in all the buildings in the area. The farms and farm buildings, private houses, church and school have all made use of what must have been a cheap local commodity. No part of this block is more than 5km. from the sea.
